analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma paccanīya duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on Pairs, the Text on the Pairs in Direct and Reverse Order

original: 8.27. Ganthaniyaduka🔽Naganthaniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naganthaniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naganthaniyaṁ🔽dhammaṁ paṭicca naaganthaniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naganthaniyaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: gantha niyaduka  na ganthaniyam dhammam paṭicca na ganthaniyaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā na ganthaniya  dhammam paṭicca na a ganthaniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na ganthaniyam dhamma

original: paṭicca naganthaniyo ca naaganthaniyo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: paṭicca na ganthaniyaḥ ca na a ganthaniyaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: With a state to be embraced as condition, a state to be embraced arises, by way of root-cause condition. With a state to be embraced as condition, a state not to be embraced arises, by way of root-cause condition. With a state to be embraced as condition, states to be embraced and not to be embraced arise, by way of root-cause condition.

original: Naaganthaniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naaganthaniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na a ganthaniyam dhammam paṭicca na a ganthaniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a state not to be embraced as condition, a state not to be embraced arises, by way of root-cause condition.

original: Naganthaniyañca naaganthaniyañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naaganthaniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na ganthaniyam ca na a ganthaniyam ca dhammam paṭicca na a ganthaniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a state to be embraced and a state not to be embraced as conditions, a state not to be embraced arises, by way of root-cause condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate pañca. (Sabbattha pañca.)
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe avigate pañca sabbattha pañca
translated: In the section on root-cause, there are five; in the section on object, two; … in the section on non-hindrance, five. (Everywhere five.)
